overview.description: Tripura, located in northeastern India, is known for its lush hills, tribal culture, and historical sites. Established as a state on January 21, 1972, it features attractions like Agartala and Udaipur.

top_destinations.name: Agartala
top_destinations.description: The capital with Ujjayanta Palace and Neermahal.

top_destinations.name: Udaipur
top_destinations.description: Known for Tripura Sundari Temple and lakes.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit the temple; enjoy boat rides.

top_destinations.name: Jampui Hills
top_destinations.description: A scenic hill station with orange orchards.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Trek to viewpoints; carry warm clothes.

culinary_delights.name: Rooftop Restaurant
culinary_delights.description: Famous for Tripuri cuisine like Mui Borok.

culinary_delights.name: Heritage Restaurant
culinary_delights.description: Known for fish curry and rice.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Bawmoh Restaurant
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Indian and local fusion.

culinary_delights.name: Street Food at Agartala Market
culinary_delights.description: Famous for phuchka and jhal muri.

must_visit_spots.name: Neermahal
must_visit_spots.description: A water palace on Rudrasagar Lake.

must_visit_spots.name: Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary
must_visit_spots.description: Home to diverse flora and fauna.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Agartala is 500 km from Guwahati (NH8, 12-14 hrs). By train: Agartala Railway Station. By air: Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport.
